text: Presets: 1. Form page located in URL: http://localhost:8080/login/login.html with this sentence: 2. Access to a protected URL like: http://localhost:8080/servlet/myservice 3. The authentication form page opens but the image doesn't appears. Tomcat tries to retrieve the image from /servlet/img/myimage.gif and it should retrieve the image from /login/img/myimage.gif
creator: vicente@deister.es

text:
When form-based login is used, the client browser does not know that the
request was internally redirected to the login page.  (The same thing happens
when you use RequestDispatcher.forward() to redirect a request to a different
servlet or JSP page to complete the response).  Therefore, the browser resolves
relative hyperlinks against the *original* request URI, rather than the request
URI of the login page.  There is nothing the server can do about this.

To work around the problem, you should do one of the following:

* Make the hyperlink for your image relative to the base of the
  server ("/login/img/myimage.gif")

* Use a <base href="/login/login.html"> element in the <head> section
  of your login page, to tell the browser what base URL to use when
  resolving relative URLs.
